almost.functional.reactive

Class Promise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • almost.functional.reactive.Promise<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type the supplier is committed to provide.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Promise<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    A Promise is a composite of a Supplier and an Observer allowing for observation or the supplier.

    This implements Runnable so that it can be tucked into a Future etc. Once the Observer is completed it is released.

    See Also:
    Observer, Consumer, Supplier

        Parameters:
        supplier - the supplier

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method calls the supplier and on successful completion informs the fulfilled consumers of the return value. If the supplier throws an exception the rejected consumers are informed. In either case when the call to the supplier completes the settled consumers are informed with an Optional containing the supplied value on success.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getState

        public Promise.State getState()
        Get the current state of this promise.
        Returns:
        the state
